title: I love all these people talking about how Poppy is supposed to be a hypercarry
body: Yeah *old poppy* was, but old poppy was pretty cancerous.

can shut down almost any all in so you'll never feed off a decent poppy in lane, but will absolutely crush you if she gets the slightest bit ahead 

the REAL poppy is a hypercarry. this is a terribly designed clone with an ugly snaggletooth and "Thor but retarded" as her lore

So don't all in her. Poke her. Use a champ without dashes and mess her up close range with somebody like a juggernaut.

Pick Darius.

Same shit with Taric; I fucking despise everything about him now, right down to his shitty dialogue, but this is the most broken he's been in years. You're damn right I'm going to abuse that.

Don't bring your dislikes of a character into balance discussion, there is no place for that here.

As for her being freelo, you are likely facing enemies who don't know what they're doing. I mean, I can see why she's good as a warden, with all the people picking dash-heavy champs suddenly getting shut down and destroyed when they try to dash on your carry, but come on, that's her job. 

As for Taric, I freaking love new Taric, and he's my go to support. He is only broken when your W partner follows up, when they don't you feel like you wasted a W cast, but when you have somebody that synergizes with your spells it is glorius.

As for abusing champs to climb, good luck when they get nerfed and you're stuck with using lower-elo tactics that you never developed because you were busy abusing "broken" champs.

Taric + Graves Duo lane bot uhuh.

Best combo ever.

>Don't bring your dislikes of a character into balance discussion, there is no place for that here.

> The same kit that has no influence outside her melee range save for a occasional ranged auto and a skillshot ult?

And despite these allegedly crippling weaknesses, she's a contested pick in competitive play and has remained one of the strongest top laners across the season.

>I used the "abusing champs" terminology because that is what you used just two posts ago referring to why you still play Poppy and Taric.

Please stop editing posts after you make them, I miss cruical stuff when you do that.

As for the poke thing, unless she can regen health (which she won't because she took CoC instead of GotU), enough poke will push her out of lane.

she has a 55% winrate against Quinn, Kennen and Jayce. 3 of the prominent ranged top laners. She's at 53% vs Illaoi and Pantheon, the only common top laners I can think of that have poke in lane. Oh, she stomps Gnar, too, but that's more because Gnar is shit right now.  The only ranged tops she loses to are Teemo (???) and Swain, who has sustain.

That's exactly why her regen is being targeted, I bet; she is absurdly hard to whittle down right now, even with one of the lower-end regen values for a tank.
Poke doesn't work against Poppy. You either build penetration items or just accept the fact that you won't deal damage to a properly built Poppy.
Or she's just a really good tank. Tanks can shut down some people pretty hard.

overwatch isn't a moba, neither is star wars. Reinhardt is the only pure tank; D.Va and Roadhog are more akin to bruisers by League standards. tanks have been dominant since season 5 and we've gone through 2 tank metas since then; if Riot wasn't so quick about nerfing CoC we'd have gone through a third one for season 7. 

dota 2 tanks would have been a better comparison but their tanks aren't just mobile CC bots. some of them do a lot of damage, some of them have a lot of team utility but still work primarily as tanks. Personally I think {{champion:113}} {{champion:79}} should be high damage champions with less CC than other tanks, but I get downvoted for suggesting any fixes to the class that would actually make them different from each other (no, different ways of applying CC is not a unique reason to pick them). riot has generally ruined their own game with these sorts of classifications, and forcing champions into very tight definitions of what they can and can't be allowed to do based on their class. if they actually want to fix the tank class then they need to loosen up.

Poppy right now is severely overnerfed; if you compare her to Jax or Fiora, she has no steroids, no active defenses outside of her akward passive, horrible scalability on her damage and weak/unusable AP damage. Current Poppy is pretty trash.

"No steroids" -> W (bonus armor and mr, doubled if below 40% health)
"No active defenses outside of her awkward passive" -> R, one of the strongest disengage tools in the game

Don't know why the lack of ap damage is an argument for an ad based champ, but ok. =/

> "No steroids" -> W (bonus armor and mr, doubled if below 40% health)

That's like what, 12 armor at lv 18? 

Also armor/mr are not offensive steroids, they don't help you kill any faster. 

> "No active defenses outside of her awkward passive" -> R, one of the strongest disengage tools in the game

One, that's incredibly slow. Two, that launches the enemy away, which can be useful if you're getting ganked, but completely worthless if you're 1v1ing someone.

> Don't know why the lack of ap damage is an argument for an ad based champ, but ok. =/

Poppy is a hybrid damage melee carry.

No offensive steroids, correct, but still steroids. Since you didn't state that you mean offensive steroids, I thought I should mention it. And her armor and mr are increased by 15% (30% if she is under 40% health). That will be much more than "12 at lvl 18" if you are building her slightly tanky.

A fully charged ult takes time, that's right. But since you said it is "completely worthless if you're 1v1 someone", you are able to interrupt the cast. The enemy doesn't get knocked away but knocked up, which is defensive while still keeping the enemy you are fighting in your range. Did you see worlds? Some Poppy players there were able to pull some great solo kills with that (and top lane solo kills are kinda special in worlds, it is not very common).
It still holds that it is a great defensive tool.

And Poppy is a hybrid damage melee carry? Because she has one AP scaling on her W? Everything in her kit is scaling with AD and you are not able to trigger the AP damage from W yourself, the enemy has to dash in it. Poppy is far away from being hybrid damage, you are taking that wrong. She is obviously AD based and not hybrid.
